page.title: 08LUCKINGTON VILLAGE.
page.content: Luckington is supposed to be the traditional birthplace of the Bristol River Avon.The village history goes back to Harold.It was due to Harold's becoming king that Luckington became a Royal Manor and so entitled to a 'Court'- Luckington Court. There are two entries in the Domesday Book relating to the village. The origin of the village name is from the word 'LOCHINTONE'.One of the entries is as follows: "Herman holds L.... from Durand. Earl Harold held it before 1066;it paid tax for 4 hides.Land for 5 ploughs.....6 villagers...8smallholders...a mill,meadow 10 acres pasture 8 acres woodland 4 acres. The value was 100s;now Â£4.
